intro: Cicerbita spicata, commonly known as the spiny celandine, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Papaveraceae. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and often invasive species in certain regions.
